correct_order: The Japanese are very efficient and such concepts as “just in time” are a witness to their efficiency
But they reach efficiency in a different way than American businesses
They reach efficiency through the route of effectiveness.
the main difference is that efficiency is a ration and effectiveness is not

sources: The Japanese are very efficient and such concepts as “just in time” are a witness to their efficiency
They reach efficiency through the route of effectiveness.
the main difference is that efficiency is a ration and effectiveness is not
But they reach efficiency in a different way than American businesses
